revised_title: Migration of Lymphocytes in Lymph Nodes: An Electron Microscope Study
tldr: The authors conducted an electron microscope study on the migration of lymphocytes through the endothelium of venules in lymph nodes. They discovered that lymphocytes migrate across the vessel wall by entering the endothelial cells and traversing their cytoplasm, rather than passing through the intercellular junctions. This research provides insights into the immune system's function and the role of lymphocytes in the body.
